result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Carlon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:14 PM Defendant Chad M Carlon in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ben Lucareli in court for Chad M Carlon. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Defendant enters plea of no contest. Plea accepted by court and found guilty. Judge hears sentence recommendations from attorneys. Defendant gives statement.  Court sentences Chad Carlon imposed 3 months jail Stayed,  Probation 12 months, conditions AODA and treatment recommended by counselor. Maintain full employment. DNA sample with in 2 weeks of today at Vilas Co. Jail, fine of $500.00 plus court costs totaling 1083.00 to be paid within 60 days. No time served credit noted.

2:40 PM Defendant Chad M Carlon appeared by video.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ben Lucareli appeared by video for Chad M Carlon. Attorneys are ready to move to pleas and sentencing.  Court authorizes parties to appear via zoom. Bond Continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

10:01 AM Defendant Chad M Carlon appeared by phone.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ben Lucareli appeared by video for Chad M Carlon. Parties have discussed stipulation.  Defense requests one additional JPTC.  Court approved.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
